title: Diagnosis and classification of portosystemic shunts: a machine learning retrospective case-control study
ai_goal: Predict the presence and subcategory of portosystemic shunts (PSS) in dogs
data_heterogeneity: Data from a single clinical laboratory over a 20-year period
preprocessing: One-hot encoding for categorical variables, handling missing values by recording below detection limit values
evaluation_metrics: Sensitivity, specificity, area under the receiver operator characteristic curve (AUC)
performance_results: Sensitivity of 94.3%, specificity of 90.5%, AUC of 0.976

title: unknown
ai_goal: Early screening for leptospirosis in dogs
performance_results: BW model: Sensitivity 100%, Specificity 90.9%, AUC 0.955; BW+MAT model: Sensitivity 100%, Specificity 93.2%, AUC 0.959

title: Bridging clinic and wildlife care with AI-powered pan-species computational pathology
species_breed: multiple species including canine, Tasmanian devil, and 18 other vertebrate species
ai_goal: To measure immune response and provide insights into cancer initiation and evolution across species
data_heterogeneity: The study includes data from multiple species and tumor types to increase heterogeneity.
preprocessing: slide digitalisation and quality control protocols
evaluation_metrics: accuracy, F1, precision, sensitivity, specificity, balanced accuracy
performance_results: High accuracy in measuring immune response for canine transmissible venereal tumour (0.94) and Tasmanian devil facial tumour disease (0.88).
ethics: The research complies with ethical regulations and was approved by relevant committees.

title: Deep learning for necrosis detection using canine perivascular wall tumour whole slide images
ai_goal: Automating necrosis detection in Whole Slide Images for improving the precision of tumour grading

title: Assessing the feasibility of applying machine learning to diagnosing non‑effusive feline infectious peritonitis
ai_goal: Clinical diagnosis of non-effusive feline infectious peritonitis
preprocessing: Feature selection, removal of highly correlated variables
performance_results: Accuracy of 97.5%, AUC of 0.969, sensitivity of 95.45%, specificity of 98.28%

title: Diagnostic Classification of Cases of Canine Leishmaniasis Using Machine Learning
ai_goal: To classify whether or not cases of canine visceral leishmaniasis are present by physical examinations
ethics: The animal protocols used in this work were evaluated and approved by the Animal Ethics and Experimentation Committee of the Center for Agricultural Sciences of the State University of Maranhão.

title: unknown
ai_goal: Enhance diagnostic accuracy and consistency of histologic diagnoses for feline chronic enteropathy
data_heterogeneity: Slides from several diagnostic laboratories with variations in image quality
evaluation_metrics: Sensitivity, Positive Predictive Value (PPV), F1 score
performance_results: Median PPV lower for intraepithelial lymphocytes; F1 scores similar for intraepithelial and lamina propria lymphocytes
